definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Qin Dynasty Stele with bamboo slips on the calligraphy reflected the characteristic of nobility and civilian.
sentences.chinese: 秦代刻石與簡牘上的書法分別反映了貴族與平民書風。

sentences.english: Following the gradual prospering of seal script and clerical script, calligraphic wind of stele school matured as well.
sentences.chinese: 而隨着篆隸書體的逐步繁榮，碑派書風亦走向成熟。

sentences.english: But the occurrence of the calligraphy style is also the inevitable result which the font continues to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 而書體的發生又是書風持續衍變的必然結果。

sentences.english: Then analyzes the style of Mi Fu have the influence reason and the significance to the Southern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 然後分析米芾書風對南宋產生影響的原因和意義。

definition: Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)
